body:
Well, I'm using sqlite, which in theory supports strftimehttps://www.sqlite.org/lang_datefunc.htmlEl 28 feb. 2018 19:16, Maxime Beauchemin <notifications@github.com> escribió:srtftime('%w',date) looks like python to me, you'll have to write a SQL expression specific to your database engine in the column expression, set that column as groupable, and that should work.

—You are receiving this because you authored the thread.Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub, or mute the thread.
@mistercrunch I've updated the logic and added a couple of unit tests which test the two scenarios.
Does anyone have a similar problem like this when using Redshift? Any help/pointer will be greatly appreciated, thanks!

Thanks for the reply. I **checked SQLAlchemy** and and the **driver 'pymssql'** separately and it works.
Rather I checked the same query in the SQLLab and there I got an Error for the tables I could not import properly for the others there is no issues.

![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/28544726/36847903-ff73f170-1d5f-11e8-9ddf-374f258adfc2.png)
And the following error msg:
> UnicodeEncodeError: 'ascii' codec can't encode character u'\xe4' in position 14: ordinal not in range(128)

I've checked the issues tagged "unicode"
Is there a fix? 
Would you recommend to switch from Py2 to Py3 like mentioned in #2554 ?
@john-bodley thanks

@fabianmenges This would be super helpful with respect to the time grain problems mentioned in https://github.com/apache/incubator-superset/issues/487
Did you manage to implement this feature on the server side in the meanwhile?

First pull request: #4513 

![superset_pr_screenshot](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17909133/36871692-ec0e0222-1d57-11e8-84db-4e0bd3c00d47.png)

if you're considering updating the vis a lot, you might consider [`@data-ui/histogram`](https://williaster.github.io/data-ui/?selectedKind=histogram) which supports some of the features you've mentioned out of the box (we have some interest in using `@data-ui` for other charts)
lgtm

What if at the end of your model running you INSERT back into your DB the info you'd want visualized?

If I'm not understanding exactly, could you give some idea about what you've visualizing in the notebook.
Looks great! I'll look into it
@mistercrunch would you mind taking another look at this? I made a few small tweaks after adding the addition of a couple of unit tests.
+1 we need it
🚢  @mistercrunch
You should be able to do that from the fabmanager cli.
OK - administrators should be able to reset users' passwords in Superset's UI
Shouldn't users be able to reset that on their own?
If a user forgets their password, an admin should be able to reset it via the UI

@hughhhh @mistercrunch I have another commit in store that I want to push. Should I
- update this PR with it?
- wait for this PR to be merged and create a new one?
- create a new PR right now in parallel to this one?

The new commit is more involved (adding group by option, multiple metrics, legends, etc)
LGTM

It seems like users have a similar issue beyond a Dashboard context. I did not realize it was possible to create a datasource/table without having access to the underlying database/schema of that datasource/table. Even with this change, they may still have that issue, as this change only solves the case of not being able to see an empty / inaccessible dashboard in the dashboard list. I do not think this fixes the issues mentioned above, unless other parts of the code have changed since then.

Ah, I see. I misread Dashboard as Datasource. 
Some parts of the code have changed. Be default, the request access form no longer shows up. permissions will now be decided on a per slice level. (https://github.com/apache/incubator-superset/pull/4405). But your change is still relevant.
@ArielStv Merged!
thanks a lot!

Hi Was any alternative found for this issue?
The connection to PostgreSQL seems fine, but when we try to upload CSV file we are getting above error.

Thanks, cheers.
I get the same error with bullet charts in 0.22.1
@hughhhh @graceguo-supercat @mistercrunch
Also, if you guys do decide to merge this, maybe we should change the thumbnail for the histogram viz?

#4513 being merged, I opened a new pull request: #4525. Let me know what you think!

![screen shot 2018-03-02 at 5 50 51 pm](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17909133/36929328-e71b83ec-1e43-11e8-8989-cba756d7ab1b.png)
That means that some other process has the sqlite database locked
Like any other flask project, see flask documentation
Authentication and authorization is implemented by flask app builder.
If there's a sqlalchemy dialect for that it should be doable, otherwise you need to implement a specific backend.
Could you please define garbled?
No clue what nohup does, and i don't think it's suggested by superset documentation. Said that plain `kill` should be fine.

Same issue for Clickhouse data source on version 0.22.1

SELECT toStartOfMinute(toDateTime(dt)) AS __timestamp,
       COUNT(*) AS number_of_requests
FROM abc
WHERE DateReceived >= toDateTime('2018-02-24 00:00:00')
  AND DateReceived <= toDateTime('2018-02-24 23:59:59')
  AND dt >= toDate('2018-02-24')
  AND dt <= toDate('2018-02-24')
GROUP BY toStartOfMinute(toDateTime(dt))
ORDER BY number_of_requests DESC
LIMIT 5000

i found anothor way  from document to start superset by using 'gunicorn -w 2 --timeout 60 -b 0.0.0.0:48088 --limit-request-line 0 --limit-request-field_size 0 superset:app', and the question will not come out again
Maybe add to .gitignore while we are at it?
@xrmx I was wondering that. It seems to be from Redis and thus it's a viable `.gitignore` candidate. I've updated the PR.

you can follow this steps https://www.asus.com/us/support/FAQ/1007483/ to turn off your pop up blockers, and in the meanwhile, you should set your  `config.py`
```
# Add endpoints that need to be exempt from CSRF protection
WTF_CSRF_EXEMPT_LIST = ['http://localhost:8080']

```
@Pek1s Congrats first PR approved! Thanks for the fixing!

I tried replicating this error as I'm currently doing some permissions cleanup but I was unable to run queries as a gamma user despite having sql_lab permissions. 

how were you able to run the query?
@graceguo-supercat
@xrmx apologies, that was my mistake. I've reverted this to `https`.

@frankhsu no results when I search the change log. 

Not a huge deal, I was just curious how to track PRs into versions.
ping @mistercrunch
lgtm

Hi @mistercrunch , I am very interested in this feature 
> Possible Future Projects/Improvements: 
Add YAML import/export for Slices.

is there any plans for that?

@yamyamyuo note that it's possible to do most of this using the ORM directly. Could be good to have a code generation feature as an export. Exporting would generate code that uses the ORM to create the slice and/or dashboard.

Check out this file for an example of how we generate the examples:
https://github.com/apache/incubator-superset/blob/master/superset/data/__init__.py#L79

Note that of course this isn't a public API, and we won't provide guarantees around forward compatibility, though it shouldn't change much.

A release is coming soon :)
@ujhujuh did you Pull request your feature? I am looking forward to use this feature.

Authorization based on datasource is more complicated when more users in superset. Think about this scenario. It is more convenient for superset admins to grant marketing dashboards permissions to marketing team members.
Welcome on board!

This is great. Now we need to figure out how to hook up the JS coverage report.

So what's going on with this feature? I have the same desire...

I think this is already reported, possibly more than one time. 

UPDATE: and maybe already been fixed. I remember a PR updating models wrt this issue

ahh my bad, I searched only in opened issues. 

dup of #3829

Correct me if I'm wrong, but I believe this issue is fixed with https://github.com/apache/incubator-superset/pull/4358

Are you still seeing the issue on the latest version?
Same here. Seems it can only execute queries returning scalars, anything else throws that error.
Thank's for the heads up. I'll rename the project on CodeTriage.

Done and done https://www.codetriage.com/apache/incubator-superset. Let me know if you're interested in a fixed PR
.
LGTM
Closing this in favor of incorporating this logic into a broader PR.
#4485 is the fix.
I think this broke the brittle `markup` viz in trunk. Has to do with the fact that the payload gets a `error` key that says `No data` and the frontend then refuses to render the viz.

I was experiencing the same issue and did some digging. It seems that as of #4298, the call to `create_engine` within `create_table_from_csv` [located here](https://github.com/apache/incubator-superset/blob/master/superset/db_engine_specs.py#L138) is using `sqlalchemy_uri` to create a new SQLAlchemy engine. This works as expected if the URI does not contain a password - however if it does, this string contains the *masked* password (i.e. `XXXXXXXX`), and authentication is attempted using that instead. Changing the line to use `sqlalchemy_uri_decrypted` instead sends the actual password, resolving the issue. 

For example:
```python
        # File "superset/db_engine_specs.py", line ~134
        # ...
        df_to_db_kwargs = {
            'table': table,
            'df': df,
            'name': form.name.data,
            'con': create_engine(form.con.data.sqlalchemy_uri_decrypted, echo=False),
            'schema': form.schema.data,
            'if_exists': form.if_exists.data,
            'index': form.index.data,
            'index_label': form.index_label.data,
            'chunksize': 10000,
        }
        # ...
```
@ktravis care to open a PR please?

Sorry @mistercrunch. I think I may have a fix and will add an additional unit test for the `markup` test. I think the solution should be:
```
class MarkupViz(BaseViz):
    def get_df(self, query_obj=None):
       return None  # like before
```
and 
```
def get_payload(self, query_obj=None):
    ...
    if df is not None and df.empty:  # previously if df is None or df.empty
        payload['error'] = 'No data'
```
Sounds about right, this area is pretty brittle around the no-query special cases...

@mistercrunch I have a deeper look at superset. I found the security part is very detailed but also complex. 
1. How did Airbnb manage the user's authorization? Pick some people as admin and grant perm when new users come? How did the admin know every user's role? Shall I grant the Finance group datasource to a marketing employee?
2. Would it be too annoying for the admin to add/delete/edit all the roles and add the roles to each users? Is there an automatic way or more efficient way?
3. Does Airbnb deploy Superset to separate environment? Such as development, staging and production environment. Does the analyst try to create the slice/dashboard in development environment and when it success, do that process again in production environment? How did the analyst create same slice/dashboard in more than one environment? We can't just copy and paste since slice cannot import/export. Did they repeat the same process in different env? 

There are so many questions🙈I am really appreciated if you can share your experience or advice!
